name: Crowned Heads - Yellow Rose - Torpedo
additionalNotes: Crowned Heads is known all around the world for their eloquent boutique offerings, but the Crowned Heads Yellow Rose has a much more specific territory. Named after a folk song from the early 1800s named 'The Yellow Rose of Texas', this Nicaraguan box-pressed torpedo is made at the renowned My Father Cigars factory in Esteli and is produced only for the Lone Star state, using a dark Connecticut Broadleaf wrapper on top of premium Nicaraguan binder and fillers for a rich taste proverbially as big as Texas.
